Text: ENRON Installed Capacity Liability Cc Jim John Given the pressing events and the Holidays I want to ensure that you are both aware of the financial consequences associated with Enrons decision to end transaction in PJMs installed capacity marketplace It is my understanding that if Enron wants to avoid the deficiency penalty of approximately it should immediately contract to acquire MW of installed capacity The market for this product closes on Friday December th I believe at am EST You can learn more about the PJM installed capacity market by contacting Tom Moleski Original Message From Moleski Thomas M Sent Thursday December PM To Drom Richard A Cc Hein Christopher Kirby J W Brown Yvette Herling Steven R Subject Importance High Rick Please be advised that we have received a request from Morgan Stanley to change the end date of transaction from to immediately Enron is the counterparty and they have given their approval to this change Following our established rules since the capacity credit market has already run for the first day this transaction can be removed is Given their recent downsizing efforts Im not sure Enron is aware that this will create a MW deficiency in their account Since the deficiency was not incurred due to load shift the interval deficiency rate of MW would apply for a total deficiency charge of Enron still has the opportunity to make this deficiency up in the daily capacity credit market if they choose to do so Please call if you have any further questions on this matter Tom Thomas M Moleski Senior Analyst Capacity Adequacy Planning Department

FW ENRON Installed Capacity Liability Cc I have just learned that the subject MW actually is in excess of Enrons obligations Thus there is no need for Enron to act tomorrow to acquire any additional installed capacity in order to avoid potential deficiency penalties Sorry for the false alarm during the Holidays Please call Tom Moleski for further details Best wishes Original Message From Drom
